Free Auto Loan Calculator 2025 - Calculate Car Payment & Interest

Calculate your monthly auto loan payments, total interest, and compare financing options. Plan your vehicle purchase with confidence using our comprehensive auto loan calculator.

How to Use Our Auto Loan Calculator

  1. Enter Vehicle Price: Input the total price of the car you wish to purchase
  2. Specify Down Payment: Enter the amount of money you plan to put down as an initial payment
  3. Set Loan Term: Choose the desired length of your loan in months or years
  4. Input Interest Rate: Enter the annual interest rate you expect to receive for your loan
  5. View Results: Instantly see your estimated monthly payment, total interest, and total cost of the loan

Auto Loan Payment Formula

Your monthly auto loan payment is calculated using the formula:

M = P × (r × (1 + r)^n) / ((1 + r)^n - 1)

Where: P = Loan Amount, r = Monthly Interest Rate, n = Number of Payments

Frequently Asked Questions

How is my auto loan payment calculated?

Your auto loan payment is determined by the principal loan amount (car price minus down payment), the interest rate, and the loan term. The calculator uses an amortization formula to spread payments over the loan period.

What factors influence my auto loan interest rate?

Your credit score is the biggest factor. Other influences include the loan term, the amount of your down payment, the type of vehicle, and current market interest rates. A higher credit score generally leads to a lower interest rate.

Is a longer auto loan term always better?

A longer loan term typically results in lower monthly payments, making the car more 'affordable' on a monthly basis. However, you'll pay more in total interest over the life of the loan. Shorter terms mean higher payments but less overall cost.

How much should I put down on a car?

While there's no strict rule, a larger down payment reduces your loan amount, which means lower monthly payments and less interest paid. Aim for at least 10-20% if possible to reduce your financial burden.

What is included in my monthly car payment?

Your monthly car payment primarily covers the principal (the amount borrowed) and interest. It may also include sales tax, registration fees, and other charges depending on your state and dealership.

Auto Loan Calculator Features

  • Payment Breakdown: See how much goes to principal vs interest
  • Total Cost Analysis: Compare total cost of different loan terms
  • Affordability Check: Ensure payments fit your budget
  • Export Results: Save and share your calculations

Car Buying Tips

  • Get pre-approved before visiting dealerships
  • Know your credit score to negotiate better rates
  • Consider the total cost, not just the monthly payment
  • Factor in insurance and maintenance costs
  • Don't forget about trade-in value if applicable
  • Shop around for the best interest rates from multiple lenders
  • Consider a larger down payment to reduce monthly payments
  • Read all loan terms carefully before signing
